Proposals must be signed in ink by an authorized person.
No proposal will be accepted after the stated deadline.
Proposals must be received by MHMR Procurement Services by Thursday, February 27, 2025, at 2:00 P.M.
Submissions must be mailed or personally delivered; MHMR is not responsible for lost or late submissions.
MHMR PROCUREMENT SERVICES, ATTN: RANDALL ELDER, 3840 HULEN STREET, SUITE 538, FORT WORTH, TEXAS 76107
Sealed envelope must state: RFP 25-008 TEMPORARY SERVICES, DO NOT OPEN UNTIL THURSDAY, FEBRUARY 27, 2025, AT 2:00 P.M.
Proposals must address each element and requirement listed throughout the RFP.
Clarifying information is required for all exceptions, deviations, or alternatives provided in the proposals.
Contractor must have a minimum of three (3) years of business in Temporary Staffing Services at the bid due date.
Include a description of the agency background, services provided, and number of years in business in the bid response.
Include a description of applicant/employee testing conducted by the agency in the bid response.
Include a description of employee training provided in the bid response.
Bids must include hourly billing rates for each job position listed on the Proposal Form.
Use the Proposal Form to quote hourly billing rates for specified personnel positions.
Contractor must comply with all State, Federal, and Local Laws (e.g., Americans with Disabilities Act, Title VII, Age Discrimination in Employment Act, Civil Rights Act of 1991).
Workers must be no less than eighteen (18) years of age.
Workers must be sober, reliable, clean, and appropriately dressed for the position.
Workers must be able to work in public areas, as well as be ready and willing to follow instructions of Supervisors.
Contractors shall conduct a background check on all temporary employees sent to MHMR (to the extent permissible by law).
MHMR reserves the right to request a copy of the Contractors’ background check of temporary employees.

item: Prohibition of Firearms, Drugs, and Alcohol
details: Contractors shall ensure MHMR that no temporary employee will arrive on MHMR premises with any type of firearms or weapons, drugs, or alcohol.
Contractors shall provide a timesheet which the temporary employee and MHMR supervisor will sign.
Submitted timesheets MUST be approved by the MHMR supervisor prior to payment.
Time sheet must be attached to the invoices submitted to MHMR for payment.
Separate invoices must be sent for each employee.
Invoices must have the correct contract rates and indicate the following: job position, start date, and end date for each week billed on invoices.
Contractor(s) may invoice weekly, bi-weekly, or monthly.
Provide a response indicating if a temporary worker can or cannot be provided.
Respond by the deadline stated in the request. Lack of response is considered inability to provide worker.
Submit employee(s) resumes by the deadline stated on the request.
A specific job description and turnaround time will be discussed at the time MHMR submits the request.
Provide acceptable candidates within 15 days of receiving the request or deadline provided, whichever comes later.

item: Indicate Ability to Fulfill Staffing Needs
details: If the contractor can fulfill temporary staffing needs for any of the positions listed in the attachment, indicate so within all responses to this RFP.
Upon award, provide MHMR with the assigned Project Manager's phone number, email, fax, and emergency phone number.
Proposals will be opened publicly at 2:00 P.M. on Thursday, February 27, 2025, at 3840 Hulen Street, Suite 538, Fort Worth, Texas 76.
8 ½ inch by 11 inches
Bound, stapled, or in a binder
Required with all pages numbered

Brief introductory letter of representation
Brief summary highlighting most important points

item: Resume of Proposed Project Manager/Account Representative
details: Include a resume for the proposed Project Manager or Account Representative.
Include an organization chart of the proposed Management Team including key personnel and their specific roles.

item: Performance Related Litigation, Arbitration, or Mediation Disclosure
details: Address any performance related litigation, arbitration, or mediation the company may be, or has been, involved in over the last five (5) years.
Identify whether the company has had any contracts terminated due to non-performance over the last five (5) years.
Identify adverse actions or sanctions by any regulatory authorities over the last five (5) years.

item: Company's Current Annual Report or Comparable Documentation
details: Include a copy of the company’s current annual report or other comparable documentation.
Provide evidence through financial documentation that the contractor is financially stable and able to provide related services in its entirety.
Include a completed W-9 form.
Include a Certificate of Insurance as required herein.
A formal letter from your CPA is an acceptable alternative for Non-Public companies.
Include a financial solvency statement confirming financial adequacy to meet expenditures for a minimum of one year.

Include a list of at least three (3) references (within the last twelve (12) months) related to the type of services or products specified in this RFP, preferably from other similarly situated governmental agencies with over 2,000 employees.
For each reference, include the name of the company, name of representative, physical address, telephone number, and email address.
Respondents must agree to furnish any and all information required by MHMR to verify references and to determine the quality and timeliness of previous work performed.

Include a statement that all products and services quoted in the proposal are in full accord with the specifications listed or include a brief listing of the specification sections with any noted exceptions.
Attachments A, C, D, E, and F must be included in the proposal.
List all exceptions to specifications, numbered by the article. Include a statement even if no exceptions are noted.
Clearly define the company's role, participation, responsibility, plan design, and implementation strategy.
Include the company methodology and project management approach for a successful project, itemized for all phases.
Clearly define MHMR's participation and responsibility.
Include a project schedule that defines tasks, responsibilities, estimated time commitments from the agency, and critical milestones.
Include a comprehensive training plan and designated trainer available to offer multiple training sessions for management and non-managerial staff.
Include illustrative or descriptive literature, brochures, specifications, drawings, diagrams etc., that provide additional contract information.
Itemized pricing for all items requested in the proposal is required. Brief notes explaining specific line items are permitted.
Contractor Proposal Form and Acknowledgement Form must be included.
Proposals may be modified or withdrawn before the deadline. Late modifications will not be considered.
Proposals submitted with knowledge of errors or omissions in the RFP are prohibited from using such errors or omissions for advantage.
Report any errors, omissions, or inconsistencies in the RFP to MHMR no later than 5 days before the proposal submission deadline.
All proposals must be an irrevocable offer valid for 120 calendar days after the proposal opening.
Proposals received after the stated deadline will be deemed late and will not be considered.
Evaluation will be based solely on information contained in the proposal as a formal response to this RFP.
MHMR has the right to reject proposals containing false, incorrect, misleading, or incomplete statements, representations, warranties, or certifications.
Oversights of a material nature may constitute grounds for rejection.
Inability to provide required components/features may constitute rejection.
Revisions will be provided via fax or email.
MHMR reserves the right to request oral presentations.
Proposals are open to public inspection after opening, except for confidential portions.
Contractor must include a written request for confidentiality for proprietary information.
Recommendation for award anticipated within 60 days after the proposal due date.
Proposals must be guaranteed as an irrevocable offer valid for 120 calendar days after the proposal due date.
MHMR has the right to award, reject, waive formalities, and accept any proposal in its best interest.
All proposals become the property of MHMR.
Must include Attachment B, indicating whether the bidder can provide the listed products, supplies, and/or services.

Must include Attachment C, stating commitment to the provisions of the solicitation. A representative with contract execution authority must sign. Any exceptions to the terms and conditions must be stated.
All provisions and stipulations within the RFP also apply to any authorized subcontractors.
Include copies of all licenses, certifications, registrations, and permits required by local, state, county, and/or federal authorities.
Proposals must contain complete and accurate pricing information.
MHMR does not discriminate against any individual or company.
Compliance with non-discrimination laws regarding religion, sex, national origin, age, disability, or political affiliation is required.

item: Immigration Reform and Control Act of 1986 Compliance
details: Certification that the company complies with all requirements regarding employee eligibility to work in the United States pursuant to the Immigration Reform and Control Act of 1986, as amended.

If services are covered under a State or Federal Performance Contract, Grant, or any contract, law, rule or regulation that requires Local Authority to utilize E-Verify, the Provider agrees to enroll and use E-Verify in addition to the I-9.
If E-Verify is applicable, provide a copy of the Maintain Company page from E-Verify to prove enrollment upon execution of the Agreement or soon thereafter.
If E-Verify is applicable, provide an electronic or hard copy screenshot of either the confirmation screen or the tentative non-confirmation screen upon request.
Attach E-Verify case verification number to Form I-9 for the three most recent hires as proof of compliance.
Submit an original and properly itemized invoice with the proposal and/or purchase order number.
Submit invoices to MHMR’s Accounts Payable Department at Accounts.Payable@mhmrtc.org or mail to P.O. Box 2603, Fort Worth, Texas 76113.
Proposals containing payment terms of less than thirty (30) days will not be accepted.
The awarded bidder is solely responsible for obtaining all applicable permits as required by local regulations.
Submit proof of Historically Underutilized Business “HUB” state certificate.
If intending to subcontract, submit completed Attachment A. If not, write 'None' on Attachment A and submit it.
Submit proof of M/W/DBE certificate with the proposal.
Complete and submit Form W-9 with Proposal Documents.
Submit proof of insurance with the proposal. Failure to do so will lead to disqualification.
Upon award, MHMR must receive a Certificate of Insurance naming MHMR as an insured party.

item: 30-Day Written Notice for Insurance Changes (Upon Award)
details: If the insurance policy is terminated or materially altered, the policy holder must provide MHMR a thirty (30) day written notice prior to the change.
The awarded company must submit a certificate of insurance as proof of coverage to the Purchasing Director at 3840 Hulen St, Suite 538, Fort Worth, Texas 76107.
Must maintain Workers' Compensation (Statutory Amount) and Employer's Liability ($500,000).
Must maintain Bodily Injury/Personal Injury ($1,000,000 per occurrence, $2,000,000 aggregate) and Property Damage ($1,000,000 aggregate).
Must maintain Bodily injury ($500,000 minimum combined single limit).
Must maintain same limits as noted above for Comprehensive Commercial General Liability.

A current Certificate of Insurance referencing the project, product, or service name and bid number must accompany all proposals.  The certificate must list MHMR, its officers, employees, and elected representatives as an additional insured.
The awarded company is responsible for ensuring all subcontractors have the required insurance coverage and provides MHMR with documentation confirming coverage.
Awarded company agrees to waive subrogation against MHMR, its officers, employees, and elected representatives.
Include requested information and provide a thorough response.
Demonstrate understanding of the project and ability to deliver in the Executive Summary.
Address technical aspects of the proposal.
Provide evidence of satisfactory past performance on similar projects, verifiable through references and self-reporting.
Include entity organization chart.
Submit resumes of management and supervisors, including an Account Manager.
Demonstrate knowledge of the latest relevant policies and practices.

MHMR reserves the right to request a BAFO based on components of the initial proposal, potentially warranting additional discussion. Submit the best possible offer initially, as discussions are not guaranteed.
Any travel requires prior approval from MHMR and timely invoice submission according to MHMR policies and procedures. Weekly travel budget has limits.
Information deemed confidential or proprietary must be clearly marked page by page and line by line.
The awarded company is responsible for contesting or defending the release of any information it deems confidential or proprietary.
The RFP and any contract resulting from it is governed, construed, and enforced in accordance with Texas law.
Any cause of action resulting in litigation will be brought in any court of appropriate jurisdiction in Tarrant County, Texas.
The agreement can be executed in multiple counterparts.
Facsimile or PDF copies of signed agreements are considered original documents with original signatures.
All work and materials must be performed to a professional standard, consistent with or exceeding industry standards.
Contractor must disclose in writing all existing or potential conflicts of interest.
Contractor cannot use MHMR's name, logo, or likeness without prior written approval.
Contractor warrants that it does not and will not boycott Israel during the contract term, as per Texas Government Code.
Contractor must comply with Texas Government Code regarding boycotting Israel.
Contractor warrants that they do not engage in scrutinized business operations in Sudan, as defined by Texas Government Code.
Contractor warrants that they do not engage in scrutinized business operations in Iran, as defined by Texas Government Code.

item: Prohibited Business Operations (Designated Foreign Terrorist Organizations)
details: Contractor warrants that they do not engage in scrutinized business operations with designated foreign terrorist organizations, as defined by Texas Government Code.
Disclosure of scrutinized business operations in Iran is required.

item: Designated Foreign Terrorist Organizations Business Operations Disclosure
details: Disclosure of scrutinized business operations with designated foreign terrorist organizations is required.

Contractor must agree to indemnify and hold harmless MHMR and its related parties from liabilities arising from bodily or property damages caused to the contractor or its personnel during the performance of contracted service activities.
